humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that there is metastatic carcinoma in one of the sentinel lymph nodes (1/1), but the axillary lymph node dissection did not reveal any metastases in the 34 assessed lymph nodes (0/34). Therefore, the N stage is N1, as per New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (No/Total).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer in the lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has metastatic carcinoma in one of one sentinel lymph node (1/1) with extranodal extension. Additionally, the axillary dissection shows 34 lymph nodes negative for metastases (0/34). Therefore, the patient's N stage is N1.
